title: React Routing (React Router)
subject: React
theory:
## Client-Side Routing
React Single Page Applications (SPAs) don't reload the page. They swap components.

### Library
`react-router-dom` is the standard library.

### Components
* `BrowserRouter`: Wrapper.
* `Routes`: Container for route definitions.
* `Route`: Maps path to component.
* `Link`: Replacement for `<a>` tag (prevents reload).

common_mistakes.correction: `<a>` tags cause a full page refresh (downloading React again). Always use `<Link>`.

exam_notes: Link to instead of a href.
summary: Routing turns a single component into a multi-page application.
